info.name: BIM360 Cost Management API List
info.description:
The collection together with the environment shows the whole list of the Endpoints which is released at 2020-01-17 as public beta.

You can refer to the https://forge.autodesk.com/en/docs/bim360/v1/overview/basics/ for the details about all these APIs.

item.name: GET all hubs of your account

exec: // find the specified project and setup the environment variable "project_id"

item.name: GET project & setup cost container Id

request.description: Returns all the budgets in a project.
Get a budget specified by ID.
Update a budget.
Create a budget in a given project.
Delete a budget.
Import a list of budgets into a project chunk by chunk. Maximum amount per chunk is 50.
Returns all the contract in a project.
Gets a contract specified by ID.
Patch Update a contract
Create a contract in a specific container.
Delete a contract item specified by ID.
Get change order types.
Create a new change order (typically a PCO) to initiate a change.
Delete an existing change order
List all the cost items in a specified project.
Get a cost item specified by ID. The returned item includes details.
Update an existing cost item
Create a new cost item in a specific container.
Delete an existing cost item.
Add existing cost items to a change order.
Remove existing cost items from a change order.
Find or create an attachment folder in BIM 360 Docs for a given item. That folder will save local files as attachments to the item. Files are saved using the Storage service.
Create an attachment in a specific container
Get all the attachments associated with an item such as a budget, contract, or cost item.
Delete a Attachment
List all the attribute definitions created to define custom attributes for a given module.
Update the existing values of multi custom attributes associated with an item such as a cost item, PCO, and so on.
Get generated documents.
List the actions that can execute on the specified item according to the itemâ€™s current state.
Perform a specified action on an item.
